title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
02:02 <sburjan`> has quit  
02:06 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
03:15 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
03:19 <sburjan`> has quit  
03:19 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
04:30 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:11 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
07:25 <DrLou> has quit  
07:36 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: hi  
07:54 <rrodriguez> has quit  
07:59 <@cjdelisle> hi  
08:04 <@cjdelisle> pulasthi: good morning  
08:06 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : hmm i was thinking start back work i left  
08:07 <pulasthi> \* thinking to  
08:07 <@cjdelisle> awesome, I assume you saw my little server/  
08:07 <@cjdelisle> ?  
08:08 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : ahh still didnt get a time to take a look. i just finished my project and did my demo a few days back  
08:08 <pulasthi> give me the weekend to catch up on what you have done  
08:08 <@cjdelisle> great, how did it go?  
08:08 <pulasthi> :)  
08:09 <pulasthi> well it works and got a good respnose  
08:09 <@cjdelisle> http://kk.l.to:8080/xwikiOnCassandra/  
08:09 <pulasthi> ive been requested to extend my internship for another 2 monts to do and extention on the same project  
08:10 <pulasthi> but i will have some free time  
08:10 <@cjdelisle> nice  
08:11 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : ahh nice :)  
08:12 <@cjdelisle> it's slow but it has not been spammed :)  
08:12 <pulasthi> :)  
08:13 <pulasthi> ahh i thought it was my connection  
08:14 <pulasthi> so have to go now, i will get back to you after i take a look on saturday i have to refresh my memory on the project :)  
08:15 <@cjdelisle> Cool, thanks. I will make sure that when this is finished your name is visible in it.  
08:15 <pulasthi> :)  
08:15 <pulasthi> bye  
08:16 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
09:00 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <lucaa> has quit  
09:03 <rrodriguez> has quit  
09:03 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <lucaa> has quit  
09:12 <jvdrean> has quit  
09:18 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <vmassol> good morning guys  
09:23 <vmassol> ok github post hook work in jenkins now, I'll modify all jobs  
09:26 <@cjdelisle> Do you care if I enable http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/?  
09:28 <vmassol> cjdelisle: why?  
09:28 <vmassol> I disabled it voluntarily  
09:28 <vmassol> I'm about to remove it completely  
09:28 <@cjdelisle> oh, you moved the tests into xwiki-enterprise?  
09:28 <vmassol> yes  
09:28 <vmassol> no  
09:28 <vmassol> I left them in the functional tests tab  
09:28 <vmassol> but split them all  
09:28 <vmassol> in order to speed up their executions  
09:29 <@cjdelisle> ahh I see  
09:31 <@cjdelisle> Problem with invitation is ipv6 attacks, greenmail binds localhost which java looks up to be ip6 and (for some reason) xwiki tries to send mail to localhost which it looks up as 127.0.0.1  
09:32 <+sburjan> vmassol: good morning. I am going to separate the 2 annotations tests in 2 diferent classes because they have another fixture  
09:32 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <jvdrean> has quit  
09:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <lucaa> has quit  
09:52 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <mmaksimov> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <mmaksimov> Hi. How can I change the default wiki footer that says the content is licensed under creative commons?  
10:13 <vmassol> mmaksimov: go in the admin  
10:13 <vmassol> presentation section  
10:17 <mmaksimov> vmassol, great, thank you  
10:26 <mmaksimov> has quit  
10:34 <jvelociter> has quit  
10:35 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ah so we should start with -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true ?  
10:35 <vmassol> (or add support for ipv6 in xwiki sendmail?)  
10:39 <@cjdelisle> I can make greenmail bind to 127.0.0.1  
10:39 <vmassol> o  
10:39 <vmassol> k  
10:52 <+sburjan> why do we need IPv6 support ?  
10:52 <vmassol> we don't  
10:52 <vmassol> it's just that there are 2 address to bind to  
10:52 <vmassol> the ipv4 and ipv6  
10:52 <vmassol> and if you don't tell greenmail which one to use it'll pick the first one I guess  
10:52 <vmassol> AFAIU  
10:53 <vmassol> cjdelisle is forcing the binding to the ipv4 address AFAIU  
10:54 <@cjdelisle> it's dns, if you do a query on localhost, for some reason it always wants to return the ip6 addr, for some other reason, the mail plugin doesn't look for an ip6 addr.  
10:54 <vmassol> http://www.icegreen.com/greenmail/javadocs/com/icegreen/greenmail/util/ServerSetup.html  
10:55 <@cjdelisle> yup, I have that locally  
10:55 <+sburjan> try disabling IPV6 from the machine  
10:55 <+sburjan> or remove it from DNS  
10:56 <vmassol> sburjan: there's a better way  
10:56 <vmassol> it's bad if our software doesn't work with ipv6 btw  
10:56 <vmassol> so it's a bad idea to remove ipv6 from the machine  
10:56 <+sburjan> just disable the bindings  
10:56 <vmassol> yes bad idea  
10:57 <vmassol> how will we be able to verify our software works with ipv6 if we disable it?  
10:58 <+sburjan> afaik most of the apps support IPv4  
10:58 <+sburjan> is there any app that doesnt support ipv4 and needs ipv6 ?  
10:58 <+sburjan> at this moment  
10:59 <vmassol> errr?  
10:59 <vmassol> did I say we should not support ipv4?  
10:59 <+sburjan> oh, I understood  
10:59 <+sburjan> you want ipv6 for testing :)  
10:59 <vmassol> mot mahcines will support both ipv4 and v6  
10:59 <vmassol> xwiki needs to work when both are supported on the machine  
11:00 <@cjdelisle> It would be embarassing if everything exploded when it got to a dual stack box. Still I dislike the way they forced ip6 on everyone by fooling with how localhost looks up  
11:00 <vmassol> yep  
11:11 <+sburjan> then let's make sure xwiki won;'t explode .. +1 for that  
11:18 <+sburjan> ok, I think I found a bug in annotations while working on tests  
11:22 <+sburjan> what param do I have to add to the create page URL in order to make it in 1.0 syntax ?  
11:22 <vmassol> just check the api sburjan  
11:22 <vmassol> actually your ide should tell you  
11:35 <vmassol> cjdelisle: doesn't seem to help: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/16/console  
11:36 <@cjdelisle> java      27618 hudsonagent   69u     IPv6          107236982      0t0       TCP localhost:3025 (LISTEN)  
11:36 <@cjdelisle> grrr  
11:37 <vmassol> what would be easy otherwise it to start the test with -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true ?  
11:38 <@cjdelisle> yea  
11:43 <lucaa> has quit  
11:45 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:46 <vmassol> cjdelisle: you're handling it right?  
11:46 <@cjdelisle> yup  
11:46 <vmassol> ool  
11:46 <@cjdelisle> should I just add it to <xwikiExecutionStartCommand>sh -f start\_xwiki.sh ${port} ${stopport}</xwikiExecutionStartCommand> ?  
11:47 <vmassol> I don't think so  
11:47 <vmassol> that would be the server side  
11:47 <vmassol> you need to add it to the client side  
11:47 <vmassol> (IMO)  
11:48 <vmassol> what you can also do  
11:48 <vmassol> is simply set it in the test  
11:48 <@cjdelisle> I don't follow.  
11:48 <vmassol> just before you start greenmail  
11:48 <vmassol> System.setProperty(....)  
11:48 <@cjdelisle> ahh, that makes sense  
11:48 <vmassol> although you'd need to do the same fro all tests using greenmail  
11:49 <vmassol> so the other option is to set it in the surefire properties  
11:49 <vmassol> in the pom.xml of ui tests  
11:49 <vmassol> <java.net.preferIPv4Stack>true</...>  
11:49 <@cjdelisle> the System.setProperty makes a ton of sense to me.  
11:50 <vmassol> when surefire sees this: <java.net.preferIPv4Stack>true</...>  
11:50 <@cjdelisle> it puts it right next to the code that needs it instead of far away.  
11:50 <vmassol> it does a System.setProperty  
11:50 <@cjdelisle> ahh I see  
11:50 <vmassol> sure but then you need to do it for all tests using greenmail  
11:50 <vmassol> http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/system-properties.html  
11:51 <vmassol> actually  
11:51 <vmassol> the syntax is  
11:51 <vmassol>               <property>  
11:51 <vmassol>                 <name>java.net.preferIPv4Stack</name>  
11:51 <vmassol>                 <value>true</value>  
11:51 <vmassol>               </property>  
11:51 <@cjdelisle> ahh  
11:52 <vmassol> the other one was the old deprecated one  
11:52 <vmassol> hmmm  
11:52 <vmassol> unless thomas put logback using it for  a reason  
11:52 <vmassol> which is to merge system propertie  
11:52 <vmassol> but for that you have:  
11:52 <vmassol>  <systemProperties combine.children="append">  
11:53 <vmassol> see bottom of http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/system-properties.html  
11:53 <@cjdelisle> I still like the thought of putting it right with the code that uses it.  
11:53 <lucaa> has quit  
11:54 <vmassol> then don't forget to also fix the watchlist test and any other using greenmail  
11:54 <vmassol> the laternative is complex, which is to introduce a XWikiGreenMail class that you need to share  
11:55 <@cjdelisle> Maybe that would make sense if we used greenmail in 5 places but for 2 it seems pedantic.  
11:55 <vmassol> yeah + all the new places to be  
11:55 <vmassol> when someone adds a new test somewhere….  
11:57 <@cjdelisle> My experience seems to show that when i find something that was built to scale it doesn't scale the way I need it to scale so I need to fix it anyway heh.  
11:58 <vmassol> of course we should investigate to see why xwiki sendmail doesn't work on the ipv6 address  
11:59 <vmassol> :)  
11:59 <vmassol> lunch bbl  
12:00 <@cjdelisle> It probably does, it's just the thorney question of which "localhost" it resolves.  
12:01 <vmassol> yes but we could retry on the other one when the first one doesn't work maybe?  
12:02 <vmassol> (not sure though - might be too magical)  
12:12 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I was wrong earlier  
12:12 <vmassol> I mixed up things  
12:12 <vmassol> the new syntax is indeed <property>name  
12:12 <vmassol> see http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/system-properties.html  
12:47 <vmassol> cjdelisle: this is not going to work  
12:47 <vmassol> ystem.setProperty("java.net.perferIPv4Stack", "true");  
12:47 <sburjan> has quit  
12:48 <vmassol> you should have copy-pasted :)  
12:48 <mflorea> has quit  
12:49 <@cjdelisle> oops  
12:49 <@cjdelisle> I should sleep  
12:50 <vmassol> that too!

16:05 <+jvdrean> sdumitriu and others: do I do something wrong here ?  
16:05 <+jvdrean> $services.xml.parse("<xml><child/></xml>")  
16:11 <+lucaa> jvdrean: sometimes it's a good idea to have a space beween tag name and closing / in compact form  
16:11 <+lucaa> <child /<  
16:11 <+lucaa> <child />  
16:11 <+lucaa> some parsers can choke on this  
16:11 <+lucaa> sorry my name is not sergiu but you know I cannot shutup  
16:12 <+jvdrean> the problem doesn't seem to be with the xml itself  
16:12 <+jvdrean> (aha btw)  
16:19 <+jvdrean> I was disturbed by the result (Document: null) but it was parsed correctly  
16:19 <+jvdrean> sorry for the noise  
16:23 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <evalica> has quit  
16:27 <+lucaa> guys, I will commit XE-923 now, although I don't have tests for it  
16:28 <+lucaa> next weeks I will be in holidays, but I will still be able to look at the mails & hudson for the beginning of the next week at least  
16:28 <+lucaa> so if anything goes wrong, I will be able to fix it  
16:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

17:08 <+lucaa> done, moved XE-923 to XWIKI-6820 and committed  
17:10 <vmassol> sburjan: ok  
17:27 <+mflorea> guys, do you know if the "editor" request parameter is really used in inline.vm ? I mean, is there someone using inline action with editor=xyz? The layout is broken if I use editor=wiki on inline action. Is this supposed to work?
